intro: Paragoldfussia barisanensis, commonly known as the Barisan Mountains golden fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange petals and vibrant foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous forests. Its flowers bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
